TopicTitle: Tourist wants Suborbital flight on the Sun

Articles.Content:
KSP 1.0, fresh install, new career, no mods.

Just noticed I have a tourist wanting a "Suborbital flight on the Sun". Paying a woeful 19500 funds for the experience. Is this a mistake or intended?

I guess you can burn retrograde near Jool to get your periapsis down then bring it up again after the contract completes, but that would still be insanely costly.

Note I haven't even been outside Kerbin's SOI yet, the Pol missions are due to a bug with taking data from the Poles of Minmus.

This is a thrill seeker. He isn't asking to die, he's asking you to get into a sub-orbital trajectory momentarily. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) Also, the partial fares are not representative of their respective bodies. You'll notice they are the same per itinerary. The sun factors into the full fare, which is 234,000 funds.
Once you've done that, we'd like you to test this TT18-A Launch Stability Enhancer in orbit.

Take the contract, fly him to the north pole using a paperplane from kerlington, cancel the contract. That should teach them a lesson.

I wouldn't mind an answer here either (or would also like to point it out as a bug). I took a 4 person tourist mission before I read the fine print. I haven't even been to Duna yet in 1.0...this seems like it should be much further along in the career given the delta-v requirements.
